column4: do you have any non-official repositories enabled in your sources.list?
dnt get u?????
have you used automatix, or otherwise added repositories that were not official ubuntu ones?
i dnt know if i did
but dnt think i would do that
try  cat /etc/apt/sources.list , does it output stuff, or crash?
if it outputs stuff, please pastebin it whatever it outputs
give me s
give me a sec
this is it http://paste.ubuntu-nl.org/13591/
it looks fine, which means your problem lies somewhere else. i'd give a thought about the possibility that your hardware is bad
while on a live CD, install the "smartmontools" package and run "smartctl -H /dev/yourHD", check that it reports good health. run a memtest (available from the live CD boot menu), as well
didnt get u???????
what didn't you get?
napster: while on a live CD, install the "smartmontools" package and run "smartctl -H /dev/yourHD", check that it reports good health. run a memtest (available from the live CD boot menu), as wel
alright, which part of that did you not get?
can u explain how its done again?
1) boot from the Live CD    2) at the menu, select Test Memory (or whatever it's called)  3) let it run for an hour or two. this will check your RAM

the other thing is  1) boot from the Live CD again, but this time just let it start up normally  2) open a terminal, and type  sudo apt-get install smartmontools   3) type  sudo smartctl -H /dev/the-device-name-of-your-HD
then wat?
then nothing, this is just to test your hardware (memory and HD) and see if it's OK.
